title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0184

segments.en: Hello everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine, and today Marco and I have an elementary level lesson for you.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天Marco和我为你们准备了一节初级课程。

segments.en: That's right, it's a new year, and so we have a lesson for you where we are going to make new decisions and have a new opportunity in the new year, right?
segments.cn: 没错，新的一年，我们有一节课要讲，关于在新的一年里做出新决定和新机会，对吧？

segments.en: That's right, so the new year is the time to change parts of your life, maybe.
segments.cn: 没错，所以新年是改变生活某些部分的时机。

segments.en: So that's what we're going to talk about today.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们要讨论这个。

segments.en: Let's listen to this dialogue three times.
segments.cn: 让我们听这个对话三遍。

segments.en: And when we come back, we'll be talking about the words and phrases in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 回来后，我们将讨论对话中的单词和短语。

segments.en: Now that it's the new year, I've decided to turn over a new leaf.
segments.cn: 现在是新年，我决定改过自新。

segments.en: Yeah?
You finally decided to wipe the slate clean?
segments.cn: 你终于决定洗心革面了？

segments.en: You got it.
I have a new job.
I'm living in a new city with new friends.
segments.cn: 我在一个新城市和新朋友一起生活。

segments.en: This is my opportunity to make some small changes in the way I live my life.
segments.cn: 这是我在生活方式上做一些小改变的机会。

segments.en: So what are you going to do?
Take up an art class or something?
Well, first of all, I've decided to stop smoking.
It's not that I'm pinching pennies or anything, it's just that I've been smoking since I was 16, and I think it's time to stop.
segments.cn: 不是因为我在省钱，而是我从16岁开始吸烟，我觉得是时候停止了。

segments.en: I'm with you on that one.
Anything else you're planning on doing?
One last thing.
I've decided to come out of the closet.
It's about time.
Alright, we're back.
And so, if you noticed, the dialogue has actually a lot of really, really rich phrases in there.
segments.cn: 如果你注意到，对话中其实有很多非常丰富的短语。

segments.en: So today, we're going to change the format a little bit, and we're going to do Fluency Builder in two different sections.
segments.cn: 今天，我们将稍微改变一下格式，分成两个部分进行流利度训练。

segments.en: So, starting out with the first one on Fluency Builder Part 1.
segments.cn: 首先是流利度训练第一部分。

segments.en: Fluency Builder So, the New Year, we think about new things, changing things.
segments.cn: 流利度训练，新年时，我们会想到新事物，改变事物。

segments.en: We have a great phrase in English to describe starting fresh, starting anew.
segments.cn: 我们有一个很好的英语短语来描述重新开始。

segments.en: And we say, turn over a new leaf.
Okay, so you turn over a new leaf.
So that means that you are going to maybe make a radical change, right?
segments.cn: 这意味着你可能会做出根本性的改变，对吧？

segments.en: Some completely new.
That's right.
So, if you think about it, it's a new chapter in your life, or a new adventure, or something like that.
segments.cn: 所以，如果你想想，这是你生活中的新篇章，或者新的冒险，或者类似的东西。

segments.en: Maybe you're going to quit your job.
Turn over a new leaf.
Start a new job.
Okay, so you can say, I'm going to turn over a new leaf, or Sarah turned over a new leaf and quit smoking.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你可以说，我要改过自新，或者Sarah改过自新并戒烟。

segments.en: Let's turn over a new leaf and forget the past.
segments.cn: 让我们改过自新，忘记过去。

segments.en: There we go.
Alright, so to turn over a new leaf.
So just imagine that you have a leaf on the ground and you turn it over and it's nice and clean.
segments.cn: 想象一下，你在地上有一片叶子，你把它翻过来，它是干净的。

segments.en: Alright, and talking about cleanliness, our second phrase is to wipe the slate clean.
segments.cn: 好的，谈到干净，我们的第二个短语是洗清旧账。

segments.en: Okay, when I think about this phrase, I think about a chalkboard.
segments.cn: 好的，当我想到这个短语时，我想到黑板。

segments.en: Okay, so a slate is like a chalkboard.
And all of the things that you've done, good and bad, are on that chalkboard.
segments.cn: 你所做的所有事情，无论好坏，都在那块黑板上。

segments.en: And to wipe the slate clean means to erase those words, erase those things.
segments.cn: 洗清旧账意味着擦掉那些字，擦掉那些事情。

segments.en: So perhaps Marco and I fight all the time and we're angry at each other.
segments.cn: 也许Marco和我总是争吵，我们彼此生气。

segments.en: Finally I say, listen, Marco, let's wipe the slate clean, let's forget the past, let's forget the things we said and start again.
segments.cn: 最后我说，听着，Marco，让我们洗清旧账，忘记过去，忘记我们说过的事情，重新开始。

segments.en: And start a new leaf.
To wipe the slate clean is to just start over.
segments.cn: 洗清旧账就是重新开始。

segments.en: You know, just to erase everything, let's forget about it and start over.
segments.cn: 你知道，就是擦掉一切，忘记它，重新开始。

segments.en: Exactly.
Alright, and so we're starting over and his friend is asking, you decided to wipe the slate clean and the friend said, you got it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们重新开始，他的朋友问，你决定洗清旧账，朋友说，你说对了。

segments.en: You got what?
What it.
What is it?
In English we love the word it.
segments.cn: 在英语中，我们喜欢用“它”这个词。

segments.en: Yeah.
Well in this case, you got it means you're right exactly, you understand what I'm talking about.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你说对了，意味着你完全正确，你明白我在说什么。

segments.en: Okay, so if you agree with me or I understand what you're talking about, you would say, you got it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你同意我，或者我明白你在说什么，你会说，你说对了。

segments.en: You got it.
You got it.
Alright, so I'm trying to explain to you maybe, Marco, something very difficult like, you know, if you add 4 and 10 you get 14, but what if you add 10 more?
segments.cn: 好的，所以我试图向你解释一些非常困难的事情，比如，你知道，如果你加4和10，你得到14，但如果你再加10呢？

segments.en: It's 24.
You got it.
Alright.
Okay, so he understands math.
Yes.
Okay, so that's the way you would use, you got it.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是你使用“你说对了”的方式。

segments.en: It's a really popular phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常流行的短语。

segments.en: I mean, you can use it on pretty much anything, not only if you're right, but also if somebody agrees with it or you promise something, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，你几乎可以在任何事情上使用它，不仅仅是当你正确时，还可以在别人同意或你承诺某事时，对吧？

segments.en: So are you going to pick me up today?
Yeah, you got it.
Okay, so it's a way to agree or to show that you're saying yes.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一种同意或表示你在说“是”的方式。

segments.en: Yes.
Okay, so why don't we listen to our dialogue again, and we'll come back shortly to look at Fluency Builder Part 2.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们再听一遍对话，然后我们很快回来看看流利度训练第二部分。

segments.en: Now that it's the new year, I've decided to turn over a new leaf.
segments.cn: 现在是新年，我决定改过自新。

segments.en: Yeah?
You finally decided to wipe the slate clean.
You got it.
I have a new job.
I'm living in a new city with new friends.
segments.cn: 我在一个新城市和新朋友一起生活。

segments.en: This is my opportunity to make some small changes in the way I live my life.
segments.cn: 这是我在生活方式上做一些小改变的机会。

segments.en: So what are you going to do?
Take up an art class or something?
Well, first of all, I've decided to stop smoking.
It's not that I'm pinching pennies or anything, it's just that I've been smoking since I was 16, and I think it's time to stop.
segments.cn: 不是因为我在省钱，而是我从16岁开始吸烟，我觉得是时候停止了。

segments.en: And with you on that one, anything else you're planning on doing?
segments.cn: 我支持你，还有其他计划吗？

segments.en: One last thing.
I've decided to come out of the closet.
It's about time.
Alright, we're back, so now let's continue with our Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了，现在让我们继续流利度训练。

segments.en: And, well, they kept talking, and the guy mentioned that he's going to stop smoking.
segments.cn: 他们继续谈话，那个家伙提到他要戒烟。

segments.en: But it's not because he is pinching pennies.
segments.cn: 但这不是因为他在省钱。

segments.en: Oh, pinching.
That sounds painful.
Okay, pinching is something you do, especially when you're a child.
segments.cn: 好的，省钱是你做的事情，尤其是当你还是个孩子的时候。

segments.en: You squeeze the skin.
Pinch.
And it hurts.
So to pinch really is to hold something with two fingers.
segments.cn: 所以捏实际上是用两个手指夹住某物。

segments.en: To pinch pennies means to try to spend very, very, very little money.
segments.cn: 省钱意味着尽量花很少很少的钱。

segments.en: So if we say, if I say, hey Marco, you want to go to dinner tonight?
segments.cn: 所以如果我们说，如果我说，嘿，马尔科，今晚想去吃晚餐吗？

segments.en: There's this really nice Italian place.
segments.cn: 有一家非常不错的意大利餐厅。

segments.en: It's a little expensive, but... Oh, I can't.
I'm sorry.
I'm really pinching pennies these days because I'm kind of broke.
segments.cn: 我最近真的在省钱，因为我有点破产。

segments.en: So maybe we'll go somewhere cheaper.
segments.cn: 所以也许我们去便宜点的地方。

segments.en: Yeah.
So actually pennies are one cent.
segments.cn: 所以实际上，便士是一分。

segments.en: One cent coins, right?
They're called pennies in the United States.
That's right.
And it's the smallest kind of money that we have in America.
segments.cn: 这是我们在美国拥有的最小的货币。

segments.en: So if you're pinching pennies, if you're saving pennies, it means you really don't have much money.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在省钱，意味着你真的没有多少钱。

segments.en: Right, you're really, really saving.
That's right.
Okay, so pinching pennies.
So he decided to quit smoking and his friend agreed with him and said, you know what?
segments.cn: 所以他决定戒烟，他的朋友同意了他说，你知道吗？

segments.en: I'm with you on that one.
Okay, so you quit smoking Marco and I quit smoking.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你戒烟，马尔科，我也戒烟。

segments.en: I'm with you on that one.
I think it's a good idea.
If I'm with you on that one, it means I agree with you.
segments.cn: 如果我支持你，意味着我同意你。

segments.en: You're doing the right thing.
So you can say I'm with you on that one or you can just say, you know what?
segments.cn: 所以你可以说我支持你，或者你可以说，你知道吗？

segments.en: I'm with you.
Do it.
I'm with you.
Or I'm with you, I agree.
Or I'm with you, I support your decision.
segments.cn: 或者我支持你，我支持你的决定。

segments.en: So you are going to go skydiving in a couple weeks.
segments.cn: 所以你打算在几周后去跳伞。

segments.en: That means you're going to jump out of an airplane.
segments.cn: 这意味着你要从飞机上跳下来。

segments.en: I'm not with you on that one.
You don't support my decision.
I think it's okay for you, but I would not want to do it personally.
segments.cn: 我觉得对你来说可以，但我个人不想这样做。

segments.en: Right, so you can do it in that way or just anything.
segments.cn: 对，所以你可以这样做，或者任何事情。

segments.en: You support somebody's decision.
I'm with you.
I'm with you on that one.
Exactly.
Alright, and our last phrase.
To come out of the closet.
So who's in the closet?
Why is somebody hiding in the closet?
segments.cn: 为什么有人躲在柜子里？

segments.en: Okay, someone's not really hiding in the closet.
segments.cn: 好吧，有人并不是真的躲在柜子里。

segments.en: This is a phrase we use to describe someone who is gay or lesbian, who has a secret about being gay or lesbian.
segments.cn: 这是我们用来描述一个有关于自己是同性恋或女同性恋秘密的人。

segments.en: So when they come out of the closet, they're telling their friends and family for the first time that this is how they feel.
segments.cn: 所以当他们出柜时，他们第一次告诉朋友和家人他们的感受。

segments.en: So it's basically a phrase that's kind of a metaphor to say, you know what, I'm going to tell everyone that I am gay or lesbian, right?
segments.cn: 所以这基本上是一个隐喻，意味着你知道，我要告诉每个人我是一名同性恋或女同性恋，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
Well, it's because in English oftentimes a closet is a place where we keep secrets.
segments.cn: 嗯，因为在英语中，衣橱通常是我们藏秘密的地方。

segments.en: Okay, and so to come out of the closet means to share your secrets with people.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以出柜意味着与人分享你的秘密。

segments.en: So sometimes in English you say you have skeletons in the closet.
segments.cn: 所以有时在英语中你会说你有衣橱里的骷髅。

segments.en: That's right.
This is a little different.
Maybe I killed someone and it's a skeleton in my closet.
segments.cn: 也许我杀了人，那是我衣橱里的骷髅。

segments.en: It's a secret that I keep.
But a skeleton in your closet can also be a very big secret, like you were once married and you never told anyone.
segments.cn: 但衣橱里的骷髅也可以是一个非常大的秘密，比如你曾经结过婚而从未告诉过任何人。

segments.en: Or I have two kids and I never told you guys.
segments.cn: 或者我有两个孩子，我从未告诉过你们。

segments.en: Right, so those are the skeletons in the closet, but in this case it's to come out of the closet and that's always related to telling somebody for the first time that you are gay or lesbian.
segments.cn: 对，所以那些是衣橱里的骷髅，但在这种情况下是出柜，这总是与第一次告诉某人你是同性恋或女同性恋有关。

segments.en: That's right, and we don't say it about being straight, which is the opposite, which is men who love women and women who love men.
segments.cn: 没错，我们不说关于直男直女的出柜，那是相反的，男人爱女人，女人爱男人。

segments.en: You don't say it about coming out of the closet there.
segments.cn: 你不说关于那里的出柜。

segments.en: You say it about being gay or lesbian.
segments.cn: 你说的是关于同性恋或女同性恋。

segments.en: Okay, so very interesting and so I think we should listen to this dialogue for the last time and we'll be back to talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 好吧，非常有趣，所以我认为我们应该最后再听一次这个对话，然后我们会回来再聊聊。

segments.en: Now that it's the new year, I've decided to turn over a new leaf.
segments.cn: 现在是新年，我决定翻开新的一页。

segments.en: Yeah?
You finally decided to wipe the slate clean?
You got it.
I have a new job, I'm living in a new city with new friends.
segments.cn: 我有一份新工作，住在一个新城市，交了新朋友。

segments.en: This is my opportunity to make some small changes in the way I live my life.
segments.cn: 这是我在生活方式上做一些小改变的机会。

segments.en: So what are you going to do?
Take up an art class or something?
Well, first of all, I've decided to stop smoking.
It's not that I'm pinching pennies or anything, it's just that I've been smoking since I was 16 and I think it's time to stop.
segments.cn: 不是因为我在省钱，而是因为我从16岁开始吸烟，我觉得是时候停止了。

segments.en: I'm with you on that one.
Anything else you're planning on doing?
One last thing.
I've decided to come out of the closet.
It's about time.
Alright, we're back.

So this is very interesting and these phrases are so common because if you have a fight with somebody, you say, you know what, let's just wipe the slate clean and start all over again or let's turn over a new leaf, let's stop fighting.
segments.cn: 所以这非常有趣，这些短语非常常见，因为如果你和某人打架，你会说，你知道吗，让我们洗清旧账，重新开始，或者翻开新的一页，停止争吵。

segments.en: And especially in New Year's, right?
Everyone makes a promise to start fresh.
segments.cn: 每个人都许下了重新开始的承诺。

segments.en: That's right.
Well, the new year, you can use a new calendar, you can take a fresh perspective on your life.
segments.cn: 好吧，新年，你可以使用新日历，可以对生活有新的看法。

segments.en: It's refreshing and I think it's good that we do this, we evaluate the things that make us happy and we evaluate the things that make us unhappy and part of that means turning over a new leaf.
segments.cn: 这很清新，我觉得我们这样做很好，我们评估让我们快乐的事情，评估让我们不快乐的事情，而其中一部分意味着翻开新的一页。

segments.en: Part of it also means apologizing to people or trying to make the relationships in your life healthier.
segments.cn: 其中一部分也意味着向人道歉或努力让你生活中的关系更健康。

segments.en: And I think it's very healthy that the person in this dialogue says, listen, I'm finally going to come out of the closet.
segments.cn: 我觉得这个对话中的人说，听着，我终于要出柜了，这非常健康。

segments.en: I'm going to be honest with my friends and family.
segments.cn: 我会对我的朋友和家人诚实。

segments.en: And that's really interesting because as we said, to come out of the closet is a phrase used in English and mostly related only in this context, so you might see it in TV shows or in a movie.
segments.cn: 这真的很有趣，因为正如我们所说，出柜是一个在英语中使用的短语，主要只与这个上下文相关，所以你可能会在电视节目或电影中看到它。

segments.en: But it's an interesting topic, still debatable all over the world about gay marriages and things like that.
segments.cn: 但这是一个有趣的话题，关于同性婚姻等问题在全世界仍然存在争论。

segments.en: That's right.
So we're curious about your New Year's resolutions.
segments.cn: 所以我们对你的新年决心很感兴趣。

segments.en: Are you going to be wiping any slates clean?
Are you going to be doing anything differently this year?
segments.cn: 你今年会有什么不同的做法吗？

segments.en: Let us know on our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 请在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 上告诉我们。

segments.en: We look forward to hearing from you and until next time.
segments.cn: 我们期待着听到你的消息，下次再见。

segments.en: Bye, everyone.
Bye.
